paragraphs.title: Collaborative Filtering:  Alternating Least Squares Matrix Factorization
Train The Model Using The Historical Training Split Of The Historical Data
paragraphs.text:
import org.apache.spark.mllib.recommendation.ALS
import org.apache.spark.mllib.recommendation.Rating

val itemRatings = itemRatingsDF.map(rating => 
  Rating(rating(0).asInstanceOf[Int], rating(1).asInstanceOf[Int], 1)
).cache()

val rank = 10
val numIterations = 20
val convergenceThreshold = 0.01

val model = ALS.train(itemRatings, rank, numIterations, convergenceThreshold)

rank: Int = 10
numIterations: Int = 20
convergenceThreshold: Double = 0.01
model: org.apache.spark.mllib.recommendation.MatrixFactorizationModel = org.apache.spark.mllib.recommendation.MatrixFactorizationModel@2e37984d

paragraphs.title: Generate Personalized Recommendations For Each Distinct User

paragraphs.text:
import org.elasticsearch.spark.sql._ 
import org.apache.spark.sql.SaveMode

val esConfig = Map("pushdown" -> "true", "es.nodes" -> "127.0.0.1", "es.port" -> "9200")
enrichedRecommendationsDF.write.format("org.elasticsearch.spark.sql").mode(SaveMode.Overwrite).options(esConfig)
  .save("advancedspark/personalized-als")

result.msg:
import org.elasticsearch.spark.sql._
import org.apache.spark.sql.SaveMode
esConfig: scala.collection.immutable.Map[String,String] = Map(pushdown -> true, es.nodes -> 127.0.0.1, es.port -> 9200)
